definition: to liken to/to compare to
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
worker/workshop/(slang) troublesome/high-maintenance (person)

sentences.english: Danyun (Red-Cloud) Valley, a name which compares the red leaves to red clouds.
sentences.chinese: 丹雲峽，把成片的紅葉比作紅色的雲彩。

sentences.english: Milton compares it to the mast of a ship.
sentences.chinese: 彌爾頓把它比作船上的桅杆。

sentences.english: In his speech, he compared the plight of gays to that of blacks during the civil-rights era.
sentences.chinese: 他在演講中將同志的境遇比作民權運動時期的黑人。

sentences.english: "I'd compare it to asking the question 'How many books are in the library?'" said Strickland.
sentences.chinese: 我想把這個問題比作‘圖書館裏有多少書？’

sentences.english: Someone likened his voice to the croaking of a bull-frog.
sentences.chinese: 有人把他的聲音比作牛蛙的叫聲。

sentences.english: So the white bags, this is an image of the breast.
sentences.chinese: 所以把那些白色袋子比作乳房。

sentences.english: The teacher is often compared to a candle.
sentences.chinese: 我們經常把老師比作紅燭。

sentences.english: Compared to atoms, the failure tolerance of bits is unforgiving.
sentences.chinese: 將其比作原子，位元的容錯都是不可原諒的。

sentences.english: likened putting together the spectacular drawings with a spider spinning a web.
sentences.chinese: 他把創作繪畫的過程比作一隻蜘蛛在織網。

sentences.english: Chinese poets often compare beautiful women to peach blossoms in spring.
sentences.chinese: 中國詩人常將美人比作春天的桃花。

sentences.english: Crick likens her departure to "the smoke of witchcraft" clearing from the group's eyes.
sentences.chinese: 克里克將她的離去比作消除團隊眼前的“巫術煙幕”。

sentences.english: I am liken to a grain of wheat with one difference.
sentences.chinese: 我被比作一顆與別的不同的麥粒。

sentences.english: Think of health care reform as being like a three-legged stool.
sentences.chinese: 你可以將醫療改革比作一個三條腿的凳子。

sentences.english: Comparing the threat to a kind of disease, they were immune to it.
sentences.chinese: 如果把這種恐嚇比作一種病毒的話，他們對它免疫。

sentences.english: Some people have compared him to Elvis.
sentences.chinese: 有些人把他比作“貓王”埃爾維斯。

sentences.english: Time is often compared to money for its preciousness.
sentences.chinese: 因其珍貴，時間經常比作金錢。

definition: to compare/to liken to/metaphor/analogy/figure of speech/figuratively
to look upon as/to regard as
to regard as
to regard as/to look upon as
to consider as/to take to be
to treat as/to regard as
to be just like/can be compared to
to be called/to be known as
to treat as/to regard as/to look upon as
to regard as/to treat as
like/as
called/to call sth (by a name)/to name
analogy/(Tw) (electronics) analog
to liken to/to compare to
to resemble/to be like/to look as if/such as/appearance/image/portrait/image under a mapping (math.)
to be just like
